{{Infobox Museum |name = The Titanic Museum |native_name = Titanic Branson |image = Titanic Museum Branson.jpg |imagesize = 250 |caption = The Titanic Museum |map_type = Missouri |map_caption = 36.638336 N, -93.280229 W |latitude = 36.638336 |longitude = -93.280229 |established = April 2006 |dissolved = |location = 3235 76 Country Blvd & Hwy 165
[[Branson, Missouri]] |type = |visitors = |director = |curator = Paul Burns |publictransit = |website = http://www.titanicbranson.com/ }} The '''Titanic Museum Attraction''' is a permanent two-story museum shaped like the [[RMS Titanic]] itself. It is located on Country Highway 76, [[Branson, Missouri]] and built half-scale to the original. The museum holds 400 pre-discovery artifacts in twenty galleries. The structure is anchored in water to create the illusion of Titanic at sea, and the 90-minute, self-guided tour is designed to give guests the sensation of being an original passenger on Titanicâs 1912 maiden voyage. As guests step through the artificial iceberg into the world of the Titanic, they are given a passenger boarding ticket. On this ticket is the name of an actual Titanic passenger and the class they were traveling. Guests will learn the individual stories of several passengers. In the Titanic Memorial Room, they will find out whether their ticketed passenger survived or perished. Titanic attraction opened in 2006. ==See also== *[[Timeline of the sinking of RMS Titanic]] Image:09-01-06-bransontitanic.jpg|The view of Titanic Museum at night Image:TheTitanicMuseum.jpg|The view of Titanic Museum during the day from the parking lot. Image:Exterior-of-the-titanic.jpg|Exterior of the Titanic Museum. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.titanicattraction.com Titanic Museum Attraction Website] [[Category:Landmarks in Missouri]] [[Category:Museums in Branson, Missouri]] [[Category:Maritime museums in Missouri]] [[Category:RMS Titanic]]
